title.narrative: Young African Leaders Initiative (YALI) - Corporation for Youth Emancipation and Development

description.narrative: CYED's main objective is the production, marketing, distribution and sales of soybean oil, Cold-pressed soybean cooking oil and technical training on nutritional value of soyabean and raw materials suppliers. Its social purpose is to carry out import and export operations of all goods to and from the Democratic Republic of Congo. It may also pose any financial, industrial, civil, commercial transaction relating directly or indirectly to its social purpose. As an entrepreneurial initiative of young people, it also provides for the coaching of youth in order to help them become more effective and capable of managing various functions and activities across agricultural value chains.

title.narrative: Echoing Green (EG) COVID-19 - Kadiwaku Family Foundation

description.narrative: Th purpose of this project is to provide funding to John Ntonta to develop a mobile app that can function offline and contains a library of educational business articles and podcasts to help current beneficiaries learn from home. Due to the increase fear of contracting COVID-19, many citizens avoid leaving their homes to ensure their health and safety. Through this application, they can receive education while staying within the comfort of their homes. This mobile application will also help maintain regular communication with beneficiaries, stakeholders and staff. In addition, due to the loss of 80% of revenue during the past 2 months, staff did not receive their salary. Therefore, a portion of the fund will be used to cover staff salary.

description.narrative: Sector: IT / Education .Beneficiaries: YALI Youth 105 of whom 53 are women. ..The grant will be used to help Congolese teachers to access the digital world and improve the quality education through awareness workshops with teachers and free training programs on basic computer literacy for teachers. Teachers will pay an affordable price in 6 monthly installments over the course of 6 months. The grant will fund Connect the Teacher pilot project which will impact 100 teachers of Minzoto primary school located at Lemba town in Kinshasa. ..The grant funds will be used to: (a) projector and materials needed to conduct trainings, (b) purchase of additional tablets and data bundles to increase stock for teachers; and (c) administrative support. .

description.narrative: Tech Power is going to implement a 40kW smart microgrid in the rural community of Rubaya, with an economically active community of more than 50 agribusinesses requiring electricity to provide reliable services. Micro-grids have been identified as a cost-effective solution to bring power to unserved, rural communities in Sub-Saharan Africa due to their ability to function independently from the main grid in addition of the ability to power economically productive uses that go above and beyond supporting basic life needs. A major anchor customer would be COOPAGRI-Kivu. Their member will be using our energy produced to reduce post-harvest losses via the introduction of renewable energy-powered cold storage technology and agro-processing activities.

description.narrative: Sector: Agribusiness/ Animal Husbandry .Beneficiaries; YALI Youth 99 of which 59 are women. ...The grant will be used to focus on local chicken feed production to facilitate an increase of feed production to 300 bags monthly. The chicken feed bag will be sold at a price that will be 30% less than import feeds, thus lowering the local cost of chicken husbandry making it affordable for consumers in Lubumbashi to have access to chicken. It will improve the living standards of 32 members of CAAPJECO Cooperative, 21 rural farmers, and 11 urban breeders. ..The grant funds will be used to: (a) expand facilitates for chicken feed production; (b) equipment to increase production output and packing; and (c) quality control to ensure the product reaches the standards for safety as well as customer satisfaction. .

description.narrative: The Recipient under this Agreement, Action Sociale et d'Organisation Paysanne (ASOP), is a legally recognized non-governmental organization in the Democratic Republic of the Congo (DRC) that has demonstrated expertise in grassroots development and serves as USADFs local technical assistance Partner in the DRC. Youlima, formed in 2015, is an organization that promotes entrepreneurship to dismantle youth unemployment. Youlima is dedicated to giving youth the tools and opportunities needed to create successful business models through dissemination of information, trainings, and seed capital to start their businesses. Through this Program, ASOP, working with the Youlima team, will act as the point of contact with the selected Entrepreneurs and Micro, Small and Medium Sized Enterprises (MSMEs) of Cohorts 2 and 3 of the Youlima Youth Incubator program in South Kivu, DRC. .ASOP will facilitate (a) the validation of 38 entrepreneurs and their owned, managed, and duly registered MSMEs in DRC, (b) validation of the selected entrepreneurs banking details and documentation, (c) confirmation of receipt of the investment toolkits by the entrepreneurs, and (d) collection of the outcome reports, financial reports, and project stories. This Cooperative Agreement grant is part of a broader collaboration with USADFs strategic partner the Citi Foundation, which is providing the funding for this grant. ASOP will coordinate with 38 entrepreneurs in the Democratic Republic of the Congo to confirm the existence of their enterprises and facilitate funds transfer for investment toolkits in the form of non-repayable capital of US$5,000 (Five Thousand United States Dollars).

description.narrative: The purpose of this project is to provide funding to Benson Wereje to strengthen the agribusiness project to sustain the food supply for refugees who are in desperate need like women and elderly. This project will also generate income to cover employee costs, and empower and educate the underprivileged to grow food indoors. In addition, this project will enhance the entrepreneurial leadership and education online content to educate 2551 students who are unable to attend physical courses due to lockdown measures. To raise awareness on safety measures concerning COVID-19, CIYOTA will send out messages in local languages to residents of Uganda and the DRC. Overall, CIYOTA aims improve the lives of refugees affected by this pandemic by training for sustainability, educating and raising awareness.

title.narrative: Youth- RLC - Kivu Paper Bag SARL

description.narrative: This grant will be used to expand production for Kivu Paper Bag SARL, a youth enterprise established to help combat the widespread damage that comes from plastic bag use. Using paper bags as a substitute will be better for the environment and provide opportunities for youth employment as well.
